p: Yet another random side project started by me.
The motivation stemmed from documenting solutions to resolving build or code errors, but may extend to other areas such as documenting some of my other personal projects.
A collection of solutions that worked for me while troubleshooting various coding problems.
I am using Windows, so the solutions may not be applicable for other OS.
Running Angular 13 on node version v16.13.2 and npm version v8.4.1
Faced this issue where even though I installed Node.js (LTS version 16.13.2) with Windows Installer, my npm version was stuck at v6.9.0.
Delete NPM and NPM-Cache folder (found in C:\Users\your_user\AppData\Roaming)
Checking npm and nodejs versions: https://nodejs.org/en/download/releases/
Your global Angular CLI version (13.0.4) is greater than your local version (6.2.9).
Got this error when running ng build --prod --base-href https://GithubUserName.github.io/GithubRepoName/.
Replace the content of .browserslistrc with the following:

In angular.json, add the CSS and JS files:

p: Quick reference on frequently used commands and how-tos.

l: Navigate to relative, preserve any query params
p: Note: Can also use 'merge' if adding new ones.

l: Retrieve params, query parameters and fragments
p: Note: params is always string. Convert by adding +params['id']
Use either canActivate to protect whole path, or canActivateChild to protect only the child paths.
Set username as the name to be displayed
Set password with a personal access token
If token has expired, re-generate at https://github.com/settings/tokens

l: Add new changes to previous commit
p: Commit must not be pushed yet.
This section covers some of my personal coding projects, the main tools used and how to install and deploy them.
Documenting solutions to resolving build/code errors and past side projects using Retype.
The setup and deploy guide is up to date with version 1.11.2
Create .github/workflows folder in the project root directory.
Add this file retype.yml to the folder.
The official guide uses main for the branch, but for my repo, my main branch was master
In retype.yml(the one in root directory), edit the url with the expected url (e.g. github_user.github.io/repo/).
Select retype branch with /(root) and save.
Github Pages will be automatically deployed whenever changes are pushed to the branch due to Github Actions.
A simple crosswords game using Angular 13.
Click on any box to select the word to fill in
The starting position is always the first character box, even if you click on another box
Boxes turn green if the input is correct, else they will turn red
Enter the letters with the given characters. Characters may be repeated
The game is won when all boxes are green
The setup and deploy guide is up to date with version 13.0.4
The --directory ./ flag is to initialize the Angular project in the current directory.
Select gh-pages branch with /(root) and save.
Deploying Angular apps to Github Pages
Recording my hiking adventures in Singapore using Gatsby.
The setup and deploy guide is up to date with version 2.25.3
Select gh-pages branch with /(root) and save.
A simple mathematics game using Angular 13.
You have 10 seconds to answer each question (timer is on the top left)
Click the alphabet that corresponds to the correct number
If an answer is wrong or 10 seconds is up, you lose and need to restart from the beginning
The setup and deploy guide is up to date with version 13.0.4
The --directory ./ flag is to initialize the Angular project in the current directory.
Select gh-pages branch with /(root) and save.
Deploying Angular apps to Github Pages
A quick reference guide on the game Monster Hunter Stories 2 using Docsify.
Quick search of monster egg with colour tags
List of monster attack patterns and weaknesses
The setup and deploy guide is up to date with version 4.4.3
Select master branch with /docs and save.
A quick reference guide on the game Stardew Valley using Angular 6.
Quick search of villagers with their likes, dislikes, schedule, and birthday
List of fishes, shops, and calendars
The setup and deploy guide is up to date with version 6.2.5
Select master branch with /(root) and save.
A simple, online playable webpage based on an actual board game called "A Little Wordy".
Documenting new stuff that I learnt.
Information is accurate as of 19th Oct 2022.
Go to Elastic Beanstalk and click "Create Environment"
Fill the following details: Application name, Environment Name, Domain (optional), Platform (see screenshot below) and click "Create enviornment"
Wait for environment to finish setting up, then you can access it from Environment.
To update and deploy the environment, use "Upload and deploy" button. (create a ZIP file of your source code)
Choose your domain name and add to cart
Remember to verify your e-mail address after purchasing the domain
On clicking the link, you should see this:
Go to Route 53 > Hosted Zones > (your domain)
For "Route traffic to", select "Alias to Elastic Beanstalk environment", (your region) and the URL for the Elastic Beanstalk environment
Enter the domain name (not elastic beanstalk URL) and pick DNS validation and request.
(not sure if I did this) Go back to Route 53 > Hosted Zones > (your domain) and create a CNAME record, putting CNAME name as Record name and CNAME value as Value.
Go to Elastic Beanstalk > Configuration > Load balancer > Edit
In Listeners, click "Add listener" and fill the following:
Types of val are optional as compiler can infer types
Semicolons are allowed but not necesary
All vals and vars have types
Expression: Has a value and/or type (evaluated)
In Scala, every single code will compute a value
If expression gives back a value
If in Scala is an expression'
Loops are discouraged in Scala as they introduce side-effects and specific to imperative programming
Everything in Scala is an expression
Special type in Scala which is similar to void
Doesn't return anything, can only hold the value ()
Side effects in Scala will return Unit
Value of a block is the value of the last expression
Calling a function is also an expression
Parameterless functions can be called with just the name
Return type needs to be defined from recursive function
Can use Unit as return type
Can define functions inside function code blocks
Use recursive call as the last expression
Add annotation @tailrec to check if it is a tail recursion

l: Call by name vs Call by value
p: by value: value is computed before call and same value is used everywhere
by name: expression is evaluated at every use
set default value of accumulator so can just call factHelper(10)
Can even pass with different order with named parameters
** Raw interpolator ** println(raw"This is a \n newline")
To add as field, change param to val age: Int
Only works with methods with only 1 parameter
For methods with no parameters. Rarely used in practice.
Need to define a method called apply
Scala does not have class level functionality ("static")
Scala object is a singleton instance.
Objects are in their own class
Can write object Person and class Person to separate singleton stuff.
Can access each other's private members
Scala object with def main(args: Array[String]): Unit or extends App
Need to pass in constructor arguments to parent class
Derived classes can override members or methods

l: Prevent inheritance with final and sealed
p: use final on the entire class
seal the class (can extend classes in this file only, prevents extension in other files)
traits do not have constructor parameters
multiple traits may be inherited by the same class
Inheriting from a class and multiple traits
Restrict only for subclass of animal
Restrict only for superclass of animal
Quick lightweight data structures with little boilerplate
Equals and hashcode implemented out of the box
Have extractor patterns = can be used in pattern matching
A group of definitions under the same name
To use a definition, be in the same package or import the package
Best practice - mirror the file structure
package object s hold standalone methods/constants (one per package)
